question: Will the price of a barrel of crude oil be $90 or more on September 12, 2022? (OCT 2022 Future)
description:
This is a market on whether the price of crude oil futures contract for October 2022 (CLV2) will settle at $90.00 or higher as of market close on September 12, 2022. If the value of OCT 22 crude futures settle at $90.00 or greater as of market close on the resolution date, this market will resolve to “Yes”. If the value of OCT 22 crude futures settles at less than $90.00 as of market close on the resolution date, this market will resolve to “No”.  

If for any reason (e.g. market holiday, emergency market closure) there is no settlement price for this market's resolution date, the settlement price of the nearest previous date will be used.  

The resolution source for this market will be CME Group's reporting on the values offered by the New York Mercantile Exchange (NYMEX) West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude oil futures, found at (https://www.cmegroup.com/markets/energy/crude-oil/light-sweet-crude.settlements.html). The resolution will be based on the value listed in the column labelled “Settle” in the row titled “OCT 22" when Final Data is available for the trade date of this market's resolution date.

question: Will the price of natural gas be $9 or more on September 12, 2022? (OCT 2022 Future)
description:
This is a market on whether the price for Henry Hub natural gas futures contracts for October 2022 (NGV2), will settle at $9.000 or higher as of market close on September 12, 2022. If the value of OCT 22 natural gas futures settles at $9.000 or greater as of market close on the resolution date, this market will resolve to “Yes”. If the value of OCT 22 natural gas futures settles at less than $9.000 as of market close on the resolution date, this market will resolve to “No”.  

If for any reason (e.g. market holiday, emergency market closure) there is no close price for this market's resolution date, the close price of the nearest previous date will be used.  

The resolution source for this market will be CME Group's reporting on the values offered by the New York Mercantile Exchange (NYMEX) for Henry Hub Natural Gas futures, found at (https://www.cmegroup.com/markets/energy/natural-gas/natural-gas.settlements.html). The resolution will be based on the value listed in the column labelled “Settle” in the row titled "OCT 22" when Final Data is available for the trade date of this market's resolution date.

question: Will USD be worth more than EUR on September 15?
description:
If the dollar price (exchange rate) of one euro (EUR) is below $1.0000 on September 15, 2022 (according to the "Price" column on investing.com), this market will resolve to "Yes". Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market is the EUR/USD currency exchange rate found on investing.com, specifically the historical daily "Price" column: https://www.investing.com/currencies/eur-usd-historical-data. If the resolution source is unavailable at the resolution time, other credible reporting may be used.

This market may resolve only after the "Price" for September 15, 2022, on the "EUR/USD Historical Data" chart is finalized. If for any reason (e.g. market holiday, emergency market closure) there is no "Price" on that chart for this market's resolution date, the "Price" of the nearest previous date will be used.
